item.description:
Ted Baker and Boohoo secure soaring online sales as New Look suffers  The Telegraph

Soaring sales at Ted Baker and Boohoo have shone a bright light into the retail gloom despite New Look enduring bitter trading on the high street. item.title: Ted Baker distances itself from high street woes as profits climb - The Telegraph
item.description:
Ted Baker distances itself from high street woes as profits climb  The Telegraph

The founder of Ted Baker has distanced the fashion brand from turmoil on the British high street after it posted a double-digit rise in profits. Sales at the FTSE 250 firm’s stores in the UK and continental Europe were flat in the year to Jan 27 and it warned of uncertainty this year after being hit by bad weather in recent weeks. But it posted a 12.3pc rise in pre-tax profits to £69m after its booming wholesale, online and North American businesses lifted group revenues 11.4pc to £592m. item.title: Moss Bros warns on profits as UK high street divides - Financial Times
item.description:
Moss Bros warns on profits as UK high street divides  Financial Times

Suit seller Moss Bros became the third British retailer to issue a post-Christmas profit warning, underscoring the deep divide between winners and losers on the high street as cautious consumers shop more selectively. item.description:

item.title: Ted Baker profits strut ahead of rivals despite slowing US growth - The Telegraph
item.description:
Ted Baker profits strut ahead of rivals despite slowing US growth  The Telegraph

Ted Baker has strutted ahead of its fashion rivals by delivering a 14pc jump in profits for the first half of the year on the back of its ambition to become a global brand. The business, which has recently opened new stores in Los Angeles and Shanghai, recorded pre-tax profits of £25.3m for the six weeks to August 12, compared to £21.5m the year before.
